{"rating": 6.4, "genres": ["Comedy", "Drama"], "review": "This film was created for a very specific audience, those over 35 years of age. It is beautifully shot and has an interesting plotline which focuses on the transition from being a young man to becoming an old man. The movie portrays how this person is affected by his aging process and how the aging process affects others around him.br br However, if you are looking for something entertaining, this is not the film for you. If you want to watch a movie about the aging process, then you may enjoy this film as it presents many different themes within the scope of aging, including the impact on relationships, death, fear, boredom, loneliness, and more.br br Overall, there were some scenes that were humorous in their approach to depicting what happens when you become older than younger people. There are some beautiful scenes of nature as well. This could be a great film to share with friends, but probably not a family film to view at home.", "num": 9012983}

{"rating": 7.2, "genres": ["Action", "Drama"], "review": "If you have not seen this before, then I suggest you get it right away. It is one of those movies where you are watching something that you know will be great from the beginning but every second, minute, hour, day, week, month, year, and forever, you will still think to yourself, 'this movie gets better.'br br This movie does not disappoint. All the actors are wonderful in their roles, especially James McAvoy, who plays an airline pilot who finds out he has lung cancer. He puts his career ahead of everything else, even though he knows he might die for sure within months. He is a very fine actor. I am also a huge fan of Sandra Bullock, so she always catches my attention as well. She really nails her role here. The story takes place mostly at the end of World War II. There is a lot of war, of course, and you get a good feel for what it was like during that time period. You also see some more modern times, and they blend together quite nicely. If you like a true story about someone's struggle against death, then this movie is definitely for you.", "num": 3715137}

{"rating": 7.2, "genres": ["Biography", "Drama", "History"], "review": "The movie was enjoyable, and informative. However, the audio was poor and inconsistent throughout the movie.br br Some scenes were clear, and others were like whispering. At times, it sounded like a whisperer was speaking directly into the camera, thus rendering the dialogue unintelligible.br br Furthermore, the movie quality varied widely. Scenes looked very clear, especially in the beginning of the movie. Later on, the resolution was poor. It is as though the movie is projected poorly upon a large screen, but then switched to video projection.br br Also, the DVD quality varies widely. Sometimes the picture seemed crystal clear. Other times, images appeared distorted. This inconsistency was present throughout the entire movie. Finally, there was a tendency to shift from video mode to a movie reel type of format. One second, it was video; the next, a throwback to early silent movies. This is frustrating.br br Also, although the movie is a biography, it feels somewhat inaccurate.br br Overall, the movie is a solid depiction of a complex figure. Unfortunately, the poor production values, particularly the audio, detract significantly from the otherwise interesting portrayal of a flawed character.br br I recommend this DVD to film enthusiasts who enjoy documentaries and biographies. Otherwise, skip this movie.", "num": 6745808}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Drama", "Romance"], "review": "This is a documentary about the Canadian band A Tribe Called Red. It tells the story of their rise to fame and how their music helped raise awareness of the plight of aboriginal peoples. It's fascinating stuff. Their music is amazing. This is a group that uses rock and roll to tell a tale about Canada's First Nations. They sing songs about the struggles of modern aboriginal people. And they do it wonderfully.br br The documentary focuses mainly on the singers. Most of them are native Canadians. There's some interviews with some of the members, but mostly the music.br br Some of the music is extremely powerful. These guys are talented musicians.br br The documentary was filmed in Canada. Sometimes the cameraman follows the singer while he sings. Other times he takes photos of the crowd. Or he takes photos of the scenery. For example, he takes a photograph of an icy river. He zooms in on it and tells the viewer how it sounds. That's a very unique way of filming a concert. Some of the shots are taken with a drone.br br Unfortunately, I have a small television and the picture quality leaves a lot to be desired. I had to turn the volume up loud to understand the lyrics. So, despite the wonderful music, I could barely follow the words. I wish there had been more closeups of the singers faces while they sang. I didn't feel like I got to know them personally. I would have liked to have known more about them as people.br br Bottom line. Its okay. Not worth $18. You'll see the same concert clips on YouTube later for free.br br Rating: 6 out of 10.", "num": 9720780}

{"rating": 7.7, "genres": ["Comedy", "Short"], "review": "This movie takes you on an emotional journey through the eyes of a boy named Paul. He's an outsider who is shunned by his fellow students due to his looks. His brother is blind and deaf. Paul feels isolated and misunderstood by his peers. He becomes obsessed with his family and struggles to fit in.br br He meets a Gypsy girl named Masha who inspires him. He starts attending her classes secretly. Their bond deepens, leading to a forbidden romance. Masha helps him overcome his insecurities.br br As Paul embraces his unique identity, he learns compassion for others. He realizes the power of selfexpression. He discovers inner strength within himself.br br This film celebrates diversity, individuality, and human connections. It explores themes of empathy, acceptance, and overcoming obstacles. It provides a message of hope for embracing differences.br br The cinematography captures the beauty of rural France, highlighting nature's healing effects on Paul. The music adds melancholy and tension, reflecting the protagonist's isolation and conflict.br br The acting is exceptional, with Mathieu Kassovitz portraying Paul with raw vulnerability, and Sandrine Bonnaire capturing Masha's spirit and passion. The script is thoughtful, allowing audiences to empathize with the character's plight. The editing creates visual interest without distracting from the storyline.br br Overall, ''La Famille Belmond'' is a profound drama, showcasing talent and creativity. It offers catharsis, reminding viewers of the power of connection. Recommended.", "num": 7635592}

{"rating": 3.9, "genres": ["Horror", "Short"], "review": "This is a decent film. The main character suffers from agoraphobia, which means she is terrified of leaving the house. She stays inside for years, listening to the radio. Her brother becomes concerned about her state of mind, and decides to investigate further. He meets another agoraphobic man, who takes him on a journey into the wilderness.br br This movie reminds me of a lot of the films directed by Jean-Claude Van Damme. Its themes are similar, although the violence is far less graphic.br br Some of the scenes are quite frightening. In addition to the darkness, there is also the psychological horror.br br There are several jump scares, but most of the audience knows when one is coming.br br The ending is somewhat predictable, but fairly enjoyable.br br Despite the quality of the filmmaking, the plotline is lacking substance. It's a simple premise, executed with low budget finesse. It feels like a trailer for a bigger production. As such, it lacks a strong sense of character development. The characters are dull, the dialogue is bland, and the acting is lackluster.br br The cinematography is beautiful. Director William H. Mallory Jr., uses shadows effectively to create mood. The editing is nice, and the score is tense.br br Overall, a mediocre effort. I recommend it to fans of horror shorts.", "num": 7951630}

{"rating": 7.3, "genres": ["Biography", "Documentary"], "review": "I love all the documentaries and interviews of the former players of Maccabi Tel Aviv Basketball Club. This one was especially enjoyable and informative because it covered some of the highlights of the team and it included interviews of several of the players including Chris Boatwright, Danny Turner, Eli Berman, and others. It covers the events surrounding the 1977 Euro League championship.br br The documentary discusses the significance of the European Championship to Israel and includes footage of the players and staff, a tour of Maccabi Tel Aviv facilities, and interviews with former team members and coaches. The film portrays the team as a tight knit group with strong friendships and brotherhood among the players. One of the challenges that the players faced was balancing the fame and success that they achieved with the relative poverty of the times and the religious values of the community. The documentary is interesting and informative for anyone interested in basketball and history, particularly in regards to the modern era.", "num": 8909017}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Comedy", "Drama", "Romance"], "review": "Great movie. This movie has been lost for awhile but I found it on YouTube.br br It's a movie full of excitement and intrigue.br br It's been referred to as the most dangerous film ever made, which sounds exciting, but is also inaccurate.br br To call it dangerous is to imply danger in real life. These actors are performing a scripted act, which includes pretending to be hurt and dying.br br But they aren't being threatened physically.br br Still, the characters are involved in plots to steal valuable objects, and several of them die in the process.br br In fact, I don't think anyone dies in real life.br br The plot involves three groups of thieves, and none of them agree with each other.br br The movie begins with a group of gypsies stealing an antique sword.br br One of them is wounded by a knife and dragged behind a truck.br br Then another gang steals a jewel box.br br Two of them are killed.br br Another gang tries to rob a museum.br br Several of them are killed.br br Eventually, all three gangs unite against a common foe-- the police.br br The movie also features some nice scenery, especially in Italy.br br It's a nice film and probably better than the average gangster movie of its era.br br However, the acting is uneven, and the plot moves slowly until the end.", "num": 242216}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Drama", "Short"], "review": "I watched this movie recently and enjoyed it tremendously. This is a true story about the experience of an Israeli immigrant entering America. To begin with, I am a Christian and thus I cannot comment on the quality of the religious aspects of the movie. However, I did enjoy watching it.br br The movie depicts a successful businessman who is forced to leave his homeland because of political reasons. His daughter moves with him. The story takes place in New York City. In addition, the main character brings his Israeli maid along with him. She speaks broken English, but nevertheless provides comic relief throughout the movie.br br Most of the scenes are filmed outdoors in the streets of Manhattan. There are a lot of shots taken of the New York skyline. For the nonbeliever, the movies gives a nice overview of the modern city.br br This is a movie about immigration, multiculturalism and diversity. The movie shows how immigrants change their environment. It is quite sad though, since the main characters lose a lot of their culture by moving to America. They seem to adapt to American ways, but simultaneously miss certain things from their original country. Their relationship deteriorates over time. The story ends happily however, with the main character finding a girlfriend.br br Although I am not familiar with Israeli politics, I can only imagine how difficult it is for immigrants to leave their native country. Especially for families with children. This movie portrays such a transition, showing how much work it requires to settle in a foreign country. Nevertheless, it seems that everyone adapts, although not perfectly.br br The acting is decent. Nothing extraordinary. The director tells the story well. He uses different camera angles and makes the images interesting visually. This is certainly worth watching, especially for nonreligious viewers looking for a documentary about immigrants settling in America.", "num": 7911432}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Action", "Sci-Fi"], "review": "I watched this movie recently because I loved the first one and I just assumed that this one would be as good or better. However, this second installment in the series, is not nearly as compelling nor does it hold the viewer's attention as the first one.br br First of all, the acting is weak. There's no chemistry between the actors. They fail to sell their characters and you can easily tell that none of them enjoyed filming this movie. They seem bored and indifferent to the material which leads to sloppy acting. In addition, the plot line is far too predictable and trite. All of the major twists and turns occur early in the film, leading to a lack of suspenseful anticipation of the rest of the storyline. Finally, the cinematography is poor. Some shots are shot in such close-ups that it's difficult to follow the dialogue being spoken. Other shots are simply boring and uneventful.br br Overall, the directing, writing and acting are poor, especially considering that the first installment was a fairly decent action movie. {"rating": 6.5, "genres": ["Crime", "Drama"], "review": "This is a story of two brothers fighting for the love of the same woman. The acting is mediocre, the script is weak, and the directing is uninspiring.br br Despite this, the film has its moments. It is sort of reminiscent of \"Am I Alive?\". It follows the journey of a man who becomes obsessed with finding his brother and saving him from the clutches of evil. However, it drags on endlessly, and eventually loses audience interest.br br Most of the characters are annoying, and the plot is weak. Not quite worthy of a PG-13 rating.br br As a film buff, I watched the entire film, hoping for a twist in the plot. However, none came. For example, one of the actors constantly tells the viewer that he knows what is happening, yet fails to provide any clues.br br Additionally, the plot unfolds slowly and predictably. The events unfold exactly as they should, rather than creating some level of unpredictability. There is no conflict whatsoever. Characters simply disappear, reappear, and die. Nothing interesting occurs.br br The cinematography is drab, lacking in any creativity or style. The dialog is trite and bland. The editing is dull and plodding. The score is generic and unimaginative.br br Finally, the acting is amateurish. The characters are poorly developed, and they act awkwardly. Also, several characters are portrayed as cardboard cutouts. They serve no purpose whatsoever, and they deliver dialogue that lacks substance.br br Overall, this is a disappointing film with zero redeeming qualities.br br Highly recommended for those with a mild curiosity for independent films. Otherwise, skip it.", "num": 7952085}

This controversial film features stunning cinematography and a haunting score, and will appeal to fans of thrillers such as End Game and Death Watch.", "num": 3651941}

{"rating": 7.0, "genres": ["Drama", "Romance"], "review": "Very sad movie. Should be banned from watching for young teens. Also, the actors are terrible except for one.br br The plot of the movie is simple, a young boy loses his parents in a car accident and is taken in by a relative, played by Richard Gere. The story is about a lost soul finding faith in God, overcoming the loss of his parents and learning how to trust the world again.br br The actor playing the young boy, Alex Marshall, is wonderful and moves the heartstrings of the viewer. Unfortunately, the rest of the cast are wooden, stiff and boring. They don't bring passion or emotion to their roles and make you want to throw the DVD in the garbage. I watched it several times and stopped watching halfway through almost every scene. The dialog was dull and contrived and most scenes lacked character development.br br The acting is mediocre at best and the script is trite and bland. The cinematography is fair, editing is average, costumes are dull and predictable. The music was forgettable.br br Only a few scenes moved along. There were moments of intense emotional drama in scenes throughout the film. The plot became stale midway through and dragged on slowly. The final revelation, however, was moving and heartfelt. It seemed that the writers and producers had been trying to incorporate messages about trust, forgiveness, faith, love, redemption and caring for others. However, none of these messages came through. The dialogue sounded scripted, stilted and fake. There was no spark, no passion, no believability, no emotion. Nothing came across convincingly. It was a shamefully boring and uninteresting movie. I recommend skipping it and seeing something worthwhile instead.", "num": 195594}

{"rating": 6.4, "genres": ["Drama", "Romance"], "review": "This film was totally bizarre. The acting was so phony and unreal that it was hilarious. I watched it twice and still can't figure out what was going on. Perhaps the director intended it to be surrealistic. If so, he succeeded admirably.br br This movie is also odd in that the main character speaks both Gaelic and English. Well, sort of. I've heard Gaelic spoken in pubs in Dublin, but never on a movie screen.br br The dialog makes absolutely no sense at all. It seems to be in foreign languages, and nobody seems to know what anyone is saying.br br Another strange element is that the cast seem to change throughout the film. One second everyone speaks English perfectly, and the next, they're speaking Gaelic.br br I finally understood this when I realized that the same actors kept appearing in different roles.br br I wondered if perhaps they were playing several characters simultaneously. Then I remembered seeing this film on TV some time ago.br br This is the same film, shot again, with subtitles added. Same plot, identical dialogue, same lousy direction. The only difference is that the viewer gets to understand what's going on this time. I checked my calendar and discovered it was the same date in the same year. They filmed this in Scotland, apparently, since I could see lochs and mountains.br br In conclusion, I give this film one star. If you enjoy films that baffle you, it's worth watching. Otherwise, skip it.", "num": 3149992}

{"rating": 6.6, "genres": ["Biography", "Documentary"], "review": "This was my first time watching Tammy Faye Baker and it has definitely become a new favorite. She seems like she would be so different in person than what she looks like on screen. It covers her entire life from when she was young till now. Her son Jamie came to California to visit his mother for a few days and they spent some quality time together as well. They seemed close enough anyway but this movie really showed how much they care for each other. And even though she hasn't been able to see him all the time because he lives with his father, he still comes to see her whenever he can and loves spending time with her. He has a daughter who reminds me of her mom. There are some good scenes of them laughing together. The movie is also very informative about religion and faith. You will learn more than you ever thought possible. If you haven't watched it yet, I highly recommend it!", "num": 6204828}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Action", "Adventure"], "review": "This movie has some nice moments in it, however, it gets bogged down in plot holes and poor acting. It starts out with a father telling his son stories about a mystical warrior named Ronin. He was trained in a discipline known as Zen, and was able to transform himself into any animal, including insects. The story goes on about a girl, and how she is haunted by an evil spirit. Now both boys are being held prisoner by a group of assassins. One night, a samurai breaks free from prison and takes the children to safety. They escape. Years later, the father and his friends return to the same town and find the boy transformed into a wolf. His sister dies in a car crash. But, miraculously, the boy survives. I was surprised to see that this film was produced by Lions Gate Entertainment Company. This is usually a higher quality picture. I was expecting a better production value. It appears to be low budget and made for television.br br Although the film has an interesting storyline, the acting is sub par. It is poorly shot and edited. The plot moves slowly, and is sometimes difficult to follow. It has potential, but lacks focus and character development. I couldn't finish watching it. {"rating": 7.8, "genres": ["Biography", "Crime"], "review": "The film has some flaws, including some scenes which are confusingly placed, and the script lacks cohesiveness. However, the plot is solid, the acting is superb, especially in the role of Van Meegeren, and the cinematography is excellent. In addition, the soundtrack adds suspenseful ambience to the storytelling.br br An intriguing true tale set during World War II, it follows Dutch businessman Han Van Meegeren, who discovers a forged signature on a document proving his family had donated $250,000 to the Gestapo. In order to clear his family's name and gain amnesty from the Dutch monarchy, he creates a fake artwork, which he sells for $3 million to the Reichsleiter Goebbels, only to realize it's a fake. After discovering a trail of forged documents leading back to the Nazis, he realizes he's been involved in a vast art smuggling scheme orchestrated by the Nazis. Forced to go undercover within the German bureaucracy, he finds himself pursued by ruthless Gestapo agents who hunt him down.br br The movie offers a compelling depiction of a sympathetic Nazi, who becomes a hunted fugitive. Its themes of deceit, loyalty, and morality are portrayed convincingly. The tension mounts throughout the 2 hour, 13 minute running time, making for an engaging viewing experience. Highly recommended!", "num": 8534229}

This movie contains nudity, violence, sexual content and strong language. If you're a parent, beware that your children may view some of these scenes.br br I loved this film when I first watched it. It became one of my favorite films and one of my top 100 movies of all time. I've watched it several times. When I first purchased it on DVD, I didn't realize it contained strong language, although it shows up here and there.br br The story begins with John Wayne as a sheriff in Colorado, 1959. It follows the deputy, Freddie Blane, played by James Caan. Their friendship blossoms throughout the movie. Brando plays the owner of a dance hall. During the dance, the owner is shot and wounded. Caan saves his life and flees the dance hall. This is the beginning of a twisted path filled with violence, betrayal, murder, revenge, kidnapping, torture, and insanity. It's a roller coaster ride of emotions that you won't be disappointed by.br br The acting in this movie is outstanding. There are some parts that reminded me of Serpico, but the writing is not nearly as good.br br I recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys action movies, especially ones involving guns, knives, and blood.
